title: idea. entity instead of multiple connections
author: Yurii84
body_snippet:
Hello!
Thank you for your work. I want to suggest an idea.
In my opinion, it would be convenient to make instead of multiple connections one entity, for example, a server at home. And there are several ways to connect it to the SSH, RDP, Https and so on. It would also be convenient to change the ip address depending on where you connect from, if you connect from home, then the connection is replaced with ip address eg 192.168.1.10. If there is a VPN connection then 10.1.2.3. If from an unknown...

iterations.description: This is a feature request to restructure the data model from connection-centric to entity/host-centric, allowing a single 'Entity' to have multiple defined connections (protocols). This is a significant architectural enhancement.

notes:
AI triage (gemini): This is a feature request to restructure the data model from connection-centric to entity/host-centric, allowing a single 'Entity' to have multiple defined connections (protocols). This is a significant architectural enhancement.
Approach: Investigate adding a 'Host' or 'Entity' node type that aggregates multiple connection profiles, or extending the 'Link to connection' (#984) feature to fully support multi-protocol entities.
